section.section: Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board before the individual may practice audiology, hearing aid dispensing, or speech-language pathology, or assist in the practice of speech-language pathology in this State.

On or after October 1, 2007, an individual hired by a Maryland local public school system, State-approved nonpublic school for handicapped children, or chartered educational institution of the State to practice speech-language pathology or assist in the practice of speech-language pathology, shall be licensed by the Board.

The Board may allow an audiologist, hearing aid dispenser, speech-language pathologist, or speech-language pathology assistant licensed in another state to practice audiology, hearing aid dispensing, or speech-language pathology, or assist in the practice of speech-language pathology in this State without a license if the audiologist, hearing aid dispenser, speech-language pathologist, or speech-language pathology assistant has a completed application for a license pending before the Board.
